item.title: Ticket #487 (upgrade.php crash) updated
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description:
Let me guess: you have Scripty Godess' Subscribe To Comments-plugin running, have you? Deactivate it and it won't happen!

This is a matter of renaming functions and has to be done either by Scripty Goddess or within the WP-core.

item.title: Ticket #488 (convert linebreaks breaks pre-tag formattting) updated
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description:
The tags in "additional information" up there got swallowed, but is shows that monospaced font gets lost on the way... ;-)

Here's the example again:

<pre>[pre] line with textp</p>

<p>[p]line with text pre</pre>

edited on: 11-24-04 12:14

edited on: 11-24-04 12:15

item.title: Ticket #488 (convert linebreaks breaks pre-tag formattting) created
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description: When posting something within pre-tags that has empty lines those empty lines get padded with p-tags by the wpautop-filter. First, this breaks XHTML because it closes tags that haven't been opened and opens tags that never get closed, and second, after the p-tags font is not monospaced as it should be within pre-tags.

item.title: Ticket #472 (Delete button on draft does not delete) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The problem occurs because post deletion from inside post.php got changed. It now uses a POST instead of a GET. The attached fix (delete.diff) makes deletion work again. If someone has an easier/better fix don't hestitate to post it.

item.title: Ticket #482 ("The password field is empty" error under IIS while login in admin panel) created
item.dc:creator: cdturri
item.description:
I installed WordPress on an IIS server and in every browser I tested (Opera, Internet Explorer, Firefox and Konqueror) it displayed an error message of "The password field is empty" when attemping to log in however it then successfully logged in and redirected to the admin console.

I solved this issue by modifying the redirection code for IIS on wp-login.php from: if ($is_IIS)

header("Refresh: 0;url=$redirect_to");

else

header("Location: $redirect_to");

to:

if ($is_IIS) { header("Refresh: 0;url=$redirect_to"); exit(); } else

header("Location: $redirect_to");

The code continued to execute after sending the refresh header, which then attempted to log in again passing a blank password. This caused the empty password field error to be displayed. However the refresh would then occur and successfully login. The new code stops execution of the script after sending the refresh header.

The bug has been found on the following versions:

1.2.1 1.3 nightly build 2004-11-11
